data.title: Diff tabs opened from the `Source Control` panel no longer in preview mode
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: OS X EI Capitan 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some project from GitHub.
2. Make some changes to a file A.cs, and save it.

3.a Stay on the editor of A.cs, and click the button of `Open Changes` on the top right corner above the editor.
4.a A diff tab opened to show the difference between the changed A.cs and the version in GitHub. Before version 1.12, this diff tab will be open in the preview mode (the tab title font is in __*italic*__), now the new diff tab is just a normal tab.

3.b Open the `Source Control` panel, click A.cs.
4.b A diff tab opened to show the difference between the changed A.cs and the version in GitHub. Before version 1.12, this diff tab will be open in the preview mode (the tab title font is in __*italic*__), now the new diff tab is just a normal tab.

5. If I have 50 files changed, and iterate the changes in the 50 files from `Source Control` panel, it will open 50 diff tabs for me! This new behaviour isn't very desired. The old behaviour in the previous versions is much more convenient and consistent with opening files from the `Explorer` panel.

data.title: `Open Changes` no longer track the file in the `Source Control` panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11
- OS Version: OS X EI Capitan 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some project from GitHub.
2. Make some changes to a file A.cs, and save it.
3. Stay on the editor of A.cs, and click the button of `Open Changes` on the top right corner above the editor.
4. A diff tab opened to show the difference between the changed A.cs and the version in GitHub. Before `version 1.11`, it will also locates to the `Source Conrol` panel and highlights A.cs in the panel. But since version 1.11, it doesn't locate to the `Source Conrol` panel and highlight the file anymore. This isn't convenient at all.

data.title: Can't type anything when launching from shell command
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.12.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Command Palette "Shell Command: install 'code' command in PATH "
2. Close current VSCode window
3. Open zsh, enter some directory,  `code .`, VSCode window shows, but I can't type any contents in the editor, though I can open new tab using keyboard shortcut 'Cmd + T',  or call Command Palette out with 'Cmd + Shift + T', still can't type any characters in the input area.

Tried to start with `code --disable-extensions .`, still not working.

data.title: Ctrl+Tab behavior not working as expected on Linux
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18.1 Serena (based on Ubuntu 16.04.4)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Hold Ctrl and press Tab to display list of recent files and select the last open file
2. Release the Tab key

Expected behavior:

The file list closes, and the editor switches to the selected file in the list, which is the previously open file.

Actual behavior:

The list remains open. Editor does not close the list until and open the selected file until the Enter key is pressed.

Notes:

I've tested this with the same version of Code on both Linux and Windows, and the incorrect behavior only seems to occur under Linux.

Screenshot:

![ctrl-tab-switcher](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/125108/25787401/67fc188c-33e4-11e7-9cd7-3610ee8754fe.png)

data.title: Better fonts for CJK users
data.body:
Hi! Thanks for your efforts in #5260! However, I'm currently experiencing the following issue:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12642018/25787157/d7c1b032-3353-11e7-9854-2900df212043.png)
The displayed menu is using a mix of Chinese font and Japanese font(I'm using zh-CN for VS Code in English Windows 10 ). Probably it's because VS Code decides the language from electron API(which uses Windows API to know that English is the system language and Japanese fonts have a priority compared with Chinese in fonts fallback in this case) instead of locale.json. Is it possible to fix that?
And also, for the editor, it would be great to automatically add a line in settings.json like 
`"editor.fontFamily": "Consolas, Microsoft Yahei UI Light, 'Courier New', monospace"`
for zh-CN VS Code users since the default Chinese font for Chinese User is quite ugly. The similar issue may occur for other CJK users.
Thanks! @be5invis

data.title: Feature Request - Related with Side Bar
data.body:
Hi! Three suggestions:
- Is it possible to add an option that enables auto-hide Side Bar when focus goes back to textedit area?
- Currently for Side Bar the word used is toggle, for Activity Bar/Status Bar the word used is hide/show. Is it possible to unify them?
- The current name for Side Bar is quite confusing. I always forget whether it refers to Side Bar or  Activity Bar. Will it be better to rename Side Bar to Side Panel and Activity Bar to Side Menu/Side Bar?
Thanks for your effort!

data.title: Feature Request - locale settings in menu or settings?
data.body: Currently locale can only be changed via editing the locale json file, which is hard to find out for beginners. Is there any plan to merge that into the main json settings file or put that into the menu(like view->language)?

data.title: settings.json is Committed When Created after Clicking Always on Commit
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: elementary OS Loki 0.4 (based on Ubuntu 16.04)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have no project based vscode settings
2. Change file a file within a git repo
3. Commit without staging any files
4. Click Always on prompt

Issue #15613 and PR #25364 added an interface which prompts the user about committing if no files are staged for commit. If the user clicks Always, it will create a settings.json file and proceed to commit all changes including the newly created settings.json file. The user did not know this file was going to get committed until after answering the prompt. I believe the setting should not be set until after the commit has taken place.

data.title: Typescript Intellisense - module resolving is refreshed when opening other editor
data.body:
Specs:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan
- Javascript/React big project containing ~2k files

Resolving modules as I see it refers to features such as Go to definition/Peek definition, intellisense completion, etc..

I will mention the fact that resolving modules (imported modules) in a file that has been just opened is noticeably slow in a large project. Suggesting a feature request to cache/index might be a topic for another issue/discussion. (6-12 seconds to resolve modules for a file)

Example:
![](https://media.giphy.com/media/xUA7aQ0QGbLnvufMek/giphy.gif)

Due to the above mentioned intellisense slowness, I faced an issue which does not occur in smaller project -
When a file is already opened and the used modules are resolved, each time I open new editor (either directly or with go to definition/peek definition) that was not open - resolving modules is retriggered/refreshed in **every** opened file.

logging.js is not opened:
![](https://media.giphy.com/media/xUPGcD4tD3sDF9FsDS/giphy.gif)

logging.js is already opened:
![](https://media.giphy.com/media/3oKIPaaPToLFnolah2/giphy.gif)

It is super noticeable when using Command + mouse click/hover to have a quick look on definition (Windows - Ctrl+mouse hover). Command + mouse hover shows a preview which is similar to peek definition, therefore resolving modules is triggered, resulting inconsistent development experience. 

![](https://media.giphy.com/media/3og0Ixp2XIyFL5iwi4/giphy.gif)

Furthermore, when using Command + mouse click, preview is triggered first and is causing resolving modules - that means a few seconds delay before opening the needed file.

![](https://media.giphy.com/media/xUA7bisQCfgwMg3vvq/giphy.gif)

My jsconfig.json file content:
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES6",
        "module": "commonjs",
        "baseUrl": ".",
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
    ]
}
```

Conclusion:
1. If all imported files used by the current file are opened, the experience is smooth.
2. **Every time a file is opened, modules resolving is triggered for all files that are already opened.**

data.title: Bad performance when logging in output panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (688b96f7dfa37b53b88eec4e6cb9af75a499fe86, 2017-05-05T15:34:02.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16188

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create `test.py` and `tasks.json` as below
2. Run the task
3. The output text is shown a big number of lines a time (instead of line by line in terminal).
4. And if you change `range(100000)` to `range(1000000)`, vscode will freeze (become really really slow).

test.py:

```python
for i in range(100000):
    print(i)
```

tasks.json:

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "python",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["test.py"],
    "showOutput": "always"
}
```

data.title: Too easy to accidentally move a file.
data.body:
Time and time again, I get errors because I have unwittingly moved a file with my mouse.
There is a dialog box asking for confirmation of a file delete.
Would it be too much to ask to have a a similar box when moving a file.
If it is considered that most people consider the benefit is outweighed by the extra click required,
perhaps there could be a Preference setting.
Thank you.

data.title: Code Folding won't be remembered after latest update.
data.body:
Code Folding won't be remembered after latest update.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Fold some Code in any file.
2. Close that file.
3. Re-open the file and the code folding is gone.

That was by far the nicest feature in VSCode, now it's gone after I updated the app today.

data.title: When VSC in Full Screen, double clicking on Console Msg in Unity, VSG does not get active before one selects 'Window' -> Bring all to Front

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:18:32.269Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |unity-tools|Tobiah|0.1.9| |unity-debug|Unity|1.2.0| |unity-snippets|YclepticStudios|0.1.2| |theme-dracula|dracula-theme|1.14.0| |eppz-code|eppz|1.2.22| |theme-material-theme|jprestidge|1.0.1| |csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|; --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. One Monitor only / Laptop: VSC in full / Maximized window 2. Run Unity, (does not matter if Unity is maximized) 3. get Console output in Unity, Double click on Console output 4. VSC Opens as should, but then again it does not: It's active in Task bar, but it's window do not appear before one force as in Screenshot. Problem: One cannot run VSC in full screen and then just get to code from unity by clicking on Unity console output..
